Class Chemical

java.lang.Object
  ObjectInGrid
      Chemical

public class Chemical
extends ObjectInGrid

This application represents Chemicals in the game.

Field Summary
private  Color color
          Color color This variable stores the color of the Chemical.
private  int direction
          int direction This variable will store the direction of the chemical (the direction that it is going towards.
private  String elementName
          String elementName This variable will store the name of the element.
private  boolean hasShifted
          boolean hasShifted This variable represents if the chemical has been shifted by the Physics class into its new position
private  int pipeExit
          int pipeExit This variable stores the pipeExit for the chemical.
private  int xCord
          int xCord, this variable represents the xCord in terms of graphics of the chemical.
private  int yCord
          int yCord, this variable represents the yCord in terms of graphics of the chemical.

Constructor Detail

Chemical

public Chemical(String picSource,
                String name,
                int x,
                int y,
                Color c,
                String elementName,
                int direction,
                int xCord,
                int yCord,
                int pipeExit)
This is the class constructor of the Chemical class, which initializes all of the variables accordingly.

Parameters:
String - picSource, which stores the colour of the picture.
String - name This represents the name of the object.
int - x This represents the x coordinate in the grid.
int - y This represents the y coordinate in the grid.
Color - c This represents the color of the object.
String - elementName This represents the name of the element.
int - direction This represents the direction as an integer value.
int - xCord This represents the x coordinate in terms of graphics (pixels).
int - yCord This represents the y coordinate in terms of graphics (pixels).
int - pipeExit This represents the pipeExit for the chemical.

act

public void act()
This method acts all of the objects accordingly. The if statements will apply the appropriate values to the x2 and y2 variables.

Parameters:
int - x2 This variable stores the int value for the second x value.
int - y2 This variable stores the int value for the second y value.
